english.system:

english.system: Reason #1 to quit smoking while you're young: You'll live longer to enjoy the future's coolest tech, like robot assistants and flying cars.

english.system: You'll find it easier to quit if you get more active. There are lots of ways to get active. Just take walks, play ball with friends or exercise. Tap pic below

english.system: If we've learned one thing from Google maps, it's to always follow directions. Do the same when using nicotine patches, gum or lozenges.

english.system: Quitting is hard, but YOU CAN DO IT! Make your family proud and quit tobacco!

english.system:
There are breathing exercises that can help you stop smoking. One can help you relax. One can perk you up.

To relax: Breathe in VERY SLOWLY through your nose, fill your lungs from bottom up, then exhale VERY SLOWLY through your mouth. Do it 3 times. Practice daily.

To perk up: Take a deep breath QUICKLY and DEEPLY through your nose, then blow it QUICKLY out your mouth. Do it 3 times. Practice daily.

spanish.system:
Hay ejercicios de respiraci√≥n que pueden ayudarte a dejar de fumar. Uno puede ayudarte a relajar y otro puede darte √°nimo.

Para relajarte: Respira MUY LENTAMENTE por la nariz y llena tus pulmones de abajo hacia arriba. Despu√©s, MUY LENTAMENTE sopla el aire por la boca. Hazlo 3 veces. Practica diariamente.

Para animarte: Respira R√ÅPIDA y PROFUNDAMENTE por la nariz y luego sopla el aire R√ÅPIDAMENTE por la boca. Hazlo 3 veces. Practica varias veces al d√≠a. Clic el pic abajo

english.system: Uncle Iroh Word of wisdom: Practice deep breathing to relax without smoking.

english.system: Because we're not all Deadpool, getting active when you quit smoking will help your body recover better AND make it easier to stay away from tobacco. You're the real hero!

q63.english: Exercise offers a powerful distraction from craving. Even walking just 30 minutes a day will help your mood and ease your stress.

q67.english: Remember, you're stronger than your cravings. Cravings are like waves---they rise and fall. Ride them out, and you'll come out stronger.

q69.english: Quitting isn't just about giving up smoking; it's about gaining health, freedom, and control. Stay focused on the benefits!

q79.english: Your body is still adjusting, and that's okay. If you feel restless or emotional sometimes, remind yourself that healing takes time. Be patient and kind to yourself.

q81.english: You are rewriting your story. Every smoke-free day is a new chapter in a healthier, happier life. Keep believing in yourself, you are capable of amazing things!

q86.english: Repeat to yourself: "Stress happens and I CAN handle it without smoking."

q88.english: Look at how far you've come! Your body is healing, your energy is increasing, and you're proving to yourself that you are stronger every day. Keep going---your future is bright!
q88.spanish: ¬°Mira lo lejos que has llegado! Tu cuerpo se est√° sanando, tu energ√≠a est√° aumentando y cada d√≠a demuestras lo fuerte que eres. ¬°Sigue adelante, tu futuro es brillante!

q101.english: You are investing in your future. Every breath is cleaner, your heart is stronger, and your body is thanking you. Keep moving forward---your best days are ahead!

q104.english: By now, your lungs are healing, your breathing is better, and your energy is up. Keep enjoying these benefits---you've worked hard for them!

q109.english: You deserve a life full of energy, health, and happiness. And that's exactly what you're creating! Celebrate your progress, and keep building the life you deserve.

q112.english: You are protecting your loved ones by staying smokefree. Now they do not have to breathe your smoke.

q115.english: You've worked hard to get here. Don't let a temporary craving make you forget your long-term goal. Stay focused---your future self will thank you!

q118.english: Remember, slip-ups can happen. What matters is getting back on track. Every day is a fresh start!

q122.english: You're not alone in this journey. Connect with friends or family who support your decision. Let them remind you why quitting is one of the best choices you've made.

q126.english: Remember why you started this journey. Whether it's for your health, family, or future, your progress is worth celebrating. ¬°Sigue adelante!

q129.english: In our culture, we value resilience and strength. Quitting smoking takes both, and you're showing that every day. ¬°Eres fuerte y capaz!

q132.english: Your body, your mind, and your future are thriving. Stay committed to this journey without smoking, and embrace the healthier person you are becoming. Keep shining!

q136.english: Your decision to quit is a gift to yourself and your loved ones. You are showing strength, determination, and self-love. Stay proud of your journey---you're doing something incredible!
q136.spanish: Tu decisi√≥n de dejar de fumar es un regalo para ti y para quienes te rodean. Est√°s demostrando fortaleza, determinaci√≥n y amor propio. ¬°Si√©ntete orgulloso de tu camino, est√°s logrando algo incre√≠ble!

q139.english: If someone offers you a cigarette, say, "No, gracias." You've come too far to let one moment set you back. Own your decision---you're in control!

q143.english: Consider the example you're setting for younger siblings, cousins, or friends. You're inspiring others with your journey. That's something to be proud of!

q146.english: Avoid or limit alcohol. Urges may be stronger when you drink and alcohol may affect your willpower, so be prepared and use your coping skills.

q150.english: Look how far you've come ! 5 months ago, smoking was part of your routine. Now, you're breaking free from it every day. This is amazing! Well done!

q157.english: Certain places or people might trigger old habits. Plan ahead! Have a game plan for what to do when cravings hit---call a friend, chew gum, or keep your hands busy.

q164.english: The hardest part is behind you, but staying smoke-free is a daily choice. Keep reminding yourself: I am not a smoker anymore.

q168.english: You are creating a new, healthier future---one where smoking doesn't control you. Stay committed, and keep believing in yourself. ¬°Lo est√°s logrando!

q171.english: You are your own hero! Quitting smoking is your superpower to protect yourself from health villains like cancer and heart disease.

english.system: OK - it's normal to get in a bad mood, slip up and smoke. Next time, instead of smoking, text BADMOOD for help!

english.system: Another great way to handle stress is to talk to someone who is glad you quit smoking, share how you are feeling and why. Tap https://goo.gl/YAlViH

english.BADMOOD: Help for bad mood situations - offers coping strategies for managing emotions without smoking

english.system:
There are breathing exercises that can help you stop smoking. One can help you relax. One can perk you up.

To relax: Breathe in VERY SLOWLY through your nose, fill your lungs from bottom up, then exhale VERY SLOWLY through your mouth. Do it 3 times. Practice daily.

To perk up: Take a deep breath QUICKLY and DEEPLY through your nose, then blow it QUICKLY out your mouth. Do it 3 times. Practice daily.

spanish.system:
Hay ejercicios de respiraci√≥n que pueden ayudarte a dejar de fumar. Uno puede ayudarte a relajar y otro puede darte √°nimo.

Para relajarte: Respira MUY LENTAMENTE por la nariz y llena tus pulmones de abajo hacia arriba. Despu√©s, MUY LENTAMENTE sopla el aire por la boca. Hazlo 3 veces. Practica diariamente.

Para animarte: Respira R√ÅPIDA y PROFUNDAMENTE por la nariz y luego sopla el aire R√ÅPIDAMENTE por la boca. Hazlo 3 veces. Practica varias veces al d√≠a. Clic el pic abajo

english.system: Nicotine is addictive and some smokers may need to use nicotine replacement to help them quit. Tap pic below

english.system: Meeting with friends? See why it's smart to manage your alcohol consumption as you also quit smoking: Tap pic below

spanish.system: ¬øVas a salir con tus amigos? Mira por qu√© es importante aprender a controlar la bebida cuando est√°s dejando de fumar: Clic el pic abajo

english.system:
You need to be ready to talk yourself out of smoking. You might tell yourself: I can have just one cigarette, that won't hurt.

You SHOULD tell yourself: If I have one, I will just want another one... and that's no good! Tap pic below

Necesitas estar listo para convencerte a ti mismo de no fumar. Podr√≠as decirte: Fumarme solo un cigarrillo no me har√° da√±o.

Debes decirte: Si me fumo uno, voy a querer otro... y eso ¬°no es bueno! Clic el pic abajo
